question_stem.en: A 25-year-old man comes to the office due to right arm weakness. The patient injured his right shoulder several months ago in a motor vehicle collision and has had difficulty raising his arm since. On examination, there is diminished pinprick and temperature sensation over a small area in the right upper lateral arm and prominent atrophy of the right deltoid with 3/5 strength on right shoulder abduction. Reflexes and handgrip strength are normal in the upper extremities bilaterally. {{exhibit_1}}
question_stem.zh: 一名25岁男性因右臂无力前来就诊。患者数月前在一次车祸中受伤右肩，自那以后便难以抬起手臂。查体显示，右侧上臂外侧一小块区域的针刺觉和温度觉减弱，右侧三角肌明显萎缩，右肩外展力量为3/5。双侧上肢的反射和握力正常。{{exhibit_1}}

question.en: This patient most likely injured which of the following nerves?
question.zh: 该患者最有可能损伤了以下哪条神经？

explanation.en:
Axillary nerve (posterior view) {{exhibit_2}}
The axillary nerve originates from the posterior cord of the brachial plexus and carries fibers from C5 and C6. It courses deep in the axilla below the shoulder joint then runs through the quadrilateral space (bounded superiorly by the teres minor, laterally by the humerus, medially by the long head of the triceps, and inferiorly by the teres major) and along the surgical neck of the posterior humerus. At this point, it gives rise to motor branches that supply the deltoid and teres minor muscles and a sensory branch that innervates the skin over the lateral shoulder.

Axillary nerve injury most commonly occurs in the setting of shoulder trauma such as anterior shoulder dislocation or fracture of the surgical neck of the humerus. Patients often have sensory loss over the upper lateral arm and weakness on shoulder abduction due to denervation of the deltoid muscle.

(Choice B) The dorsal scapular nerve provides motor innervation to the rhomboids (which retract the scapula) and levator scapulae muscles (which elevate the scapula).

(Choices C and G) Injury to the long thoracic nerve or thoracodorsal nerve can occur during axillary lymph node dissection. Long thoracic nerve injury results in paralysis of the serratus anterior muscle, leading to winging of the scapula. Thoracodorsal nerve injury results in paralysis of the latissimus dorsi muscle, leading to weakness of arm adduction, extension, and internal rotation at the shoulder.

(Choice D) Proximal injury to the median nerve (eg, due to supracondylar humerus fracture) may result in palmar sensory loss over the first 3 digits and impairment of thumb flexion/opposition/abduction, flexion of the second/third digits, and wrist flexion/abduction.

(Choice E) Injury to the musculocutaneous nerve can cause sensory loss over the lateral forearm and weakened elbow flexion due to denervation of the biceps brachii and brachialis muscles.

(Choice F) Injury to the radial nerve at the axilla (eg, crutch palsy) typically causes weakness of the forearm, hand, and finger extensor muscles (eg, wrist drop, absent triceps reflex) with sensory loss over the posterior arm and forearm and dorsolateral hand.

(Choice H) Ulnar nerve injury most commonly occurs at the elbow, resulting in sensory loss over the medial 1½ digits of the hand and weakness on wrist flexion/adduction, finger abduction/adduction, and flexion of the fourth/fifth digits.

Educational objective:
Injury to the axillary nerve most commonly occurs in the setting of shoulder trauma (eg, anterior shoulder dislocation, surgical neck of the humerus fracture). It presents with sensory loss over the lateral shoulder and weakness on shoulder abduction (due to denervation of the deltoid muscle).
explanation.zh:
腋神经（后视图） {{exhibit_2}}
腋神经起源于臂丛的后束，携带来自C5和C6的纤维。它在肩关节下方的腋窝深处走行，然后穿过四边孔（上界为小圆肌，外侧为肱骨，内侧为肱三头肌长头，下界为大圆肌）并沿肱骨后方的外科颈走行。在此处，它发出运动支，支配三角肌和小圆肌，以及支配上臂外侧皮肤的感觉支。

腋神经损伤最常发生在肩部外伤的情况下，例如肩关节前脱位或肱骨外科颈骨折。患者通常会在上臂外侧出现感觉缺失，并且由于三角肌去神经支配而导致肩外展无力。

（选项B）肩胛背神经向菱形肌（回缩肩胛骨）和肩胛提肌（抬高肩胛骨）提供运动神经支配。

（选项C和G）胸长神经或胸背神经的损伤可能发生在腋窝淋巴结清扫术中。胸长神经损伤会导致前锯肌麻痹，导致肩胛骨翼状改变。胸背神经损伤导致背阔肌麻痹，导致肩部手臂内收、伸展和内旋无力。

（选项D）正中神经近端损伤（例如，由于肱骨髁上骨折）可能导致前3个指头的掌侧感觉缺失，拇指屈曲/对掌/外展受损，第2/3个指头屈曲受损，以及腕屈曲/外展受损。

（选项E）肌皮神经损伤可导致前臂外侧感觉缺失，并由于肱二头肌和肱肌去神经支配而导致肘屈曲减弱。

（选项F）腋窝处的桡神经损伤（例如，拐杖瘫痪）通常会导致前臂、手和手指伸肌无力（例如，腕下垂，肱三头肌反射消失），并伴有上臂后侧和前臂以及手背外侧感觉缺失。

（选项H）尺神经损伤最常发生在肘部，导致手内侧1½个指头感觉缺失，以及腕屈曲/内收、手指外展/内收和第4/5个指头屈曲无力。

教育目标：
腋神经损伤最常发生在肩部外伤的情况下（例如，肩关节前脱位，肱骨外科颈骨折）。它表现为上臂外侧感觉缺失和肩外展无力（由于三角肌去神经支配）。

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of the axillary nerve anatomy, function, and common injury patterns following shoulder trauma. It requires recognizing the clinical presentation of axillary nerve damage based on sensory and motor deficits. 

The key to solving this question is to correlate the patient's symptoms (lateral shoulder sensory loss and deltoid weakness) with the specific nerve responsible for innervating those areas. Understanding the anatomical course of the axillary nerve and its vulnerability to injury during shoulder dislocations is crucial.
summary.zh:
本题考察了腋神经的解剖、功能以及肩部外伤后常见的损伤模式。它要求根据感觉和运动缺陷识别腋神经损伤的临床表现。

解决此问题的关键在于将患者的症状（上臂外侧感觉缺失和三角肌无力）与负责支配这些区域的特定神经联系起来。了解腋神经的解剖走行及其在肩关节脱位期间易受损伤的情况至关重要。

tags: Axillary nerve; Shoulder dislocation; Deltoid muscle; Nerve injury; Brachial plexus; Motor weakness; Sensory loss; Orthopedics; Neurology
